history.content:
famalam cs61c is always savage no matter who teaches it

=================================

I took it F16, and it was significantly harder than usual. However, they were a lot more generous with the curve at the end, and our final grade average was higher than previous semesters.

But yes, his tests are very ...creative. I would almost say badly designed. The final revolved around one topic that the other professor (Prof. Boser) talked about in one lecture. Boser handled this topic very poorly, and no one really understood it. Then, significant portions of the final were dedicated to that topic. 

So I'm not sure you can pin all of it on Katz. 

================================================================

From what I heard, it was Boser's first time teaching it and he was the one who wrote the final. Historically, Katz's finals are usually the same. Since Boser isn't teaching it, you should be ok. Either way, 61C is tough.

I took it F16, and it was significantly harder than usual. However, they were a lot more generous with the curve at the end, and our final grade average was higher than previous semesters.

But yes, his tests are very ...creative. I would almost say badly designed. The final revolved around one topic that the other professor (Prof. Boser) talked about in one lecture. So I'm not sure you can pin all of it on Katz.

I took it F16, and it was significantly harder than usual. However, they were a lot more generous with the curve at the end, and our final grade average was higher than previous semesters.

But yes, his tests are very ...creative. I would almost say badly designed. The final revolved around one topic that the other professor (Prof. Boser) talked about in one lecture. Boser handled this topic very poorly, and no one really understood it. Then, significant portions of the final were dedicated to that topic. 

So I'm not sure you can pin all of it on Katz.

I enjoyed the class! It was extremely difficult and I devoted the majority of my time to it. However, Katz and Boser were really helpful during office hours. The student answer is correct in that Boser was the main lecturer in F16, so it is hard to tell how difficult it was be next fall.

children.subject: I also took it in Fa16 and had a great time. It wasn't easy, but I felt much more prepared and comfortable with the material after taking the course. You will learn a ton, and Katz has a lot of really neat research experiences to share, too!

history.content: I read past Piazza and Facebook posts and found that 61C with him in fall 2016 was really hard (especially the final). Can someone please comment on experience of 61C with him?
history.subject: Is CS 61C with Prof. Katz really hard?
